intro: Chondrorhyncha caudata, commonly known as the long-tailed hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are linear and often have a distinctive blue or purple hue, while the flowers are yellow with prominent central disk. Chondrorhyncha caudata is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
